comments.body: The experimental content in the new updates should not be considered a cheat. Most of the cheats content requires cheats to access.
Especially the Create New World UI and the experimental new Edit World UI disables achievements, but not their older versions.
I think that the game needs bags, backpacks, belts, quivers, maybe even scabbards of different quality, but the starting inventory should be reduced.
DIS IS A AMAZING IDEA PROS NEED THIS THING

Just leather seems a wee bit cheap for something as substantial as an expansion to the player's inventory. Considering the experimental recipe of a bundle uses the fairly challenging to get rabbit hide and that thing has a significantly less powerful effect than actually adding extra slots to the player's inventory, there must be something to keep the player from instantly obtaining one of these within their first Minecraft day.

I'd say a chest is a must within the recipe, leather is a logical material to be included as well, but the gatekeeper resources should probably be something like a couple of gold ingots, one in every corner, so the final recipe is 1 chest, 4 leather and 4 gold ingots. Maybe even swap the top piece of leather for a rabbit hide to make it even more challenging without completely breaking the coherence of the recipe's shape (rabbit hide would be the backpack's lid is my reasoning here).
Just give me a simple backpack with 27 slots and I will be happy. It should be crafted by surrounding a chest in seven leather.
it will be cooler if it's with japonaise style

I am sad that I was making a train station, planning for a hopper to feed the furnace at a station to make it constantly travel around my village, until I realized it doens't exist in my version. Not only I wish to have the standart rail that is more cool looking, but also, the normal cart don't grab other carts along with it, and replacing everything with the eletric rails makes it go too fast for my liking. On top of everything, if I don't make everything powered up, the cart just stop moving at the normal tracks once I go too far of the loaded chunk.

 

I just wanted a choo choo train, not a race way. Hope it comes to Bedrock one day.
Why do these sound like real advancements lol
